data.inputDescription: A string {{S}} where we give a command in the English programming language.
data.outputDescription: The output of interpreting the given command.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have to write an interpreter for a subset of the English programming language. For this exercise, you only need to implement the write command, which has the following syntax:

write <the text to be written here>.
(note the dot at the end)

For example: write hello world!.
That is, the text to be printed will be provided between write and . (the dot character). If one of these is missing, print Syntax Error. This is the only case of syntax error in this exercise. Also, there can be a maximum of one occurrence of write and ., and those won't appear in text to be printed.

In addition to the above syntax, there can be the optional argument N times specifying that you should print the text N times, separated by newlines. This argument can appear anywhere in the command, outside the text to be written. Some examples: 1 times write hello world!. or write I'm done. 5 times.

Finally, the whole command can optionally be prefixed by please.

Input/Output examples:
Input:
write hello world!.
Output:
hello world!

Input:
please 3 times write I'm done.
Output:
I'm done
I'm done
I'm done
Input
A string S where we give a command in the English programming language.
Output
The output of interpreting the given command.
Constraints
Example
Input
write Hello World!.
Output
Hello World!
